description: Number of ways to arrange integers 1 through n so that the sum of each adjacent pair is prime, not counting reversals.
comments: Similar to A036440, but not requiring 1 to be first and n to be last.
example: a(5)=2 since 1,4,3,2,5 and 3,4,1,2,5 have the property that the sum of each adjacent pair is prime.
author: _Jud McCranie_
extensions: More terms from Max Alekseyev, Jan 04 2008
